intro: Aneilema paucifolium, commonly known as the few-leaved aneilema, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Aneilema paucifolium is often grown as a decorative plant due to its compact size and attractive foliage.
